messageBody:
Chris Eppstein wrote:

> Does anyone know of any utilities that can check for test coverage. This
> could be a simple as an Ant task or maybe a more complicated plug-in for
> JUnit or even a stand alone utility. Any ideas? I'd like to not re-invent
> the wheel if something like this exists already.
>

Hi Chris,

I had good success with NoUnit. It measures method-level coverage exercised by
JUnit tests only, as far as I can tell, so if you're looking for statement and
branch coverage it won't hit the mark.

http://nounit.sourceforge.net/

Here's the Ant task I used:

<target name="coverage" depends="compile, compile-tests">

<java fork="yes"

classname="net.firstpartners.nounit.ui.command.CommandLineProcessor">
<classpath>
<path location="./lib/nounit.jar" />
<path location="./lib/jdom.jar" />
<path location="./lib/xml.jar" />
<path location="./lib/xalan.jar" />
<path location="./lib/xerces.jar" />
<path location="./lib/jclasslib.jar" />
</classpath>
<arg line="start_dir ${classes.dir}"/>
<arg line="output_dir ${docs.dir}"/>
<arg line="report_class
net.firstpartners.nounit.report.CallsReport" />
<arg line="report_name c:/tools/nounit/xslt/no-unit.xsl"/>
<arg line="output_file TestCoverage.html"/>
</java>
</target>

Hope this helps.

Regards,

Mike
